metadata.title: CVE-2015-6582 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The decompose function in platform/transforms/TransformationMatrix.cpp inBlink, as used in Google Chrome before 45.0.2454.85, does not verify that amatrix inversion succeeded, which allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (uninitialized memory access and application crash) or possiblyhave unspecified other impact via a crafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6582` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
chromium-browser-l10n - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
chromium-chromedriver - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
oxideqmlscene - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2

No subscription required
